text: vertexattrib
Reads a vertex attribute value from a geometry.
<type> vertexattrib(<geometry>, string attribute_name, int linear_vertex_index, int &success)
Unlike

, this function does not have a version that takes a primitive number and primitive vertex number. If you have a primitive number and primitive vertex number, you can convert them into a linear index using
<type>[] vertexattrib(<geometry>, string attribute_name, int linear_vertex_index, int &success)
When running in the context of a node (such as a wrangle SOP), this argument can be an integer representing the input number (starting at 0) to read the geometry from.
Alternatively, the argument can be a string specifying a geometry file (for example, a
.bgeo
) to read from. When running inside Houdini, this can be an
op:/path/to/sop
reference.
<geometry>
The name of the attribute (or intrinsic) to read.
attribute_name
A linear index into the list of all vertices. If you have a primitive number and primitive vertex number, you can convert them into a linear index using
linear_vertex_index
The function overwrites this variable with
if the attribute exists and was read successfully, or
otherwise.
success
The value of the given attribute on the given point number.
